    Colores Documentos Gráficas Tablas

    Tidy association result

    get_association.Rd

    Detect pair type and carry out the appropiate association test. It can be passed two vectors (x and y) or a dataframe.

    Uso

    get_association(
  x,
  y,
  name_x = NULL,
  name_y = NULL,
  df,
  pairs_to_check,
  return_df
)

# S3 método para default
get_association(
  x,
  y,
  name_x = NULL,
  name_y = NULL,
  df,
  pairs_to_check,
  return_df
)

# S3 método para data.frame
get_association(
  df,
  pairs_to_check = NULL,
  return_df = FALSE,
  x,
  y,
  name_x,
  name_y
)

    Argumentos

    x

    A vector.

    y

    A vector.

    name_x

    Optional. Name of the x variable (character).

    name_y

    Optional. Name of the y variable (character).

    df

    A data.frame with the required data.

    pairs_to_check

    NULL (default), a character vector, a dataframe of two columns or a named list.

    return_df

    If TRUE, when is passed a dataframe, is returned a dataframe as well instead of a named list.

    Valor

    A dataframe or a named list with the results.

    Detalles

    If the input is a dataframe, when pairs_to_check is not specified all possible combinations between variables are taken into account. If it is a character vector of variable names, only these pair combinations will be used. Besides, it can be a dataframe with two columns specifying the desired pairs. Finally, it can be a named list in which each name is a variable name, and each element is a character vector with the names of the variables to combine with the element name. See Examples.

    Ejemplos

    
# DATA FOR THE EXAMPLES #

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
df <- mtcars %>%
 filter( carb != 6 & carb != 8 ) %>%
 mutate( across(c(cyl,vs,am,gear, carb), as.factor) )

## VECTORS ##
get_association(df$mpg, df$disp)
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘broom’
get_association(df$mpg, df$am)
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘broom’


## DATA.FRAMES ##

## all columns combination
get_association(df[,c(1,2,3,9)], return_df = T)
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘broom’

## only this variables combination
get_association(df, pairs_to_check = c('cyl','disp','gear'),return_df = F )
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘broom’


## only these pairs of combinations
df_pairs <- data.frame( 'x'=c('cyl','disp','gear'),
                        'y'= c('gear','vs','mpg'))

get_association( df, pairs_to_check = df_pairs, return_df = T )
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘questionr’

## for each variable the desired combinations:
list_pairs <- list( 'mpg' = c('cyl','disp','vs'),
                    'cyl' = c('disp','vs','am')
 )

get_association( df, pairs_to_check = list_pairs, return_df = T )
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘broom’
